channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

New York spells out marketing, packaging rules for legal marijuana sellers. https://t.co/kA1hnY0Git

Sorry I don't believe Susan Collins was conned re Kavanaugh. She gets away with bullshit like this by playing dumb, which she has to do as a Republican who gets re-elected by a Democratic state. https://t.co/62OxLTqL84
If there is even a scintilla of truth to this her only option is to resign and let her Democratic governor replace her with someone who has credibility because she has none.
But there's more. This wasn't some kind of clue to Collins about who Kavanaugh really is?
https://t.co/BbDU2HxQv1
BTW, never noticed this before but Kavanaugh looks like Butthead. https://t.co/JUM9Pr3yWc
Technically, Monkeypox Already is a Pandemic. https://t.co/SG3h10p3cS
2014: Why the Facebook API works better for me. https://t.co/bqWuZWFH4T
@KenSmith that's a good line! ;-)

1/3 I connected with people on Twitter's developer relations team today. They had a conference call that I dialed into, and the conversation turned to devs big wish for the Twitter API, that we organize the code so that from a browser-based app you can communicate directly with
2/3 twitter, without having to run a server app as an intermediary. This has always been a big opportunity, but now there's communication. I've been developing apps using the Twitter API since 2006, and this is the first time I've had a conversation with developers at the
3/3 company. Real progress. There's *lots* of untapped potential here, Twitter's service is an incredible network resource, and there are many millions of users. Lots to do, and I already have a next step in mind. As they say, still diggin! üòç
@mikeyanderson I see -- no it's Node.js.
@mikeyanderson what is RoR
@SarahSquirm @willmenaker The Departed.
